personalInfo.education: San Jose State University (2011, Business Management)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Subject to second reshuffle (first eight events)
tourBios.carHigh:
Has also competed on Golden State Tour. 

2013: Played in nine PGA TOUR Canada events, making eight cuts. Had four top-12 finishes, including a victory in the Wildfire Invitational...Also secured a T7 at the Tour Championship to finish the season third on the Order of Merit, which secured him a spot on the Web.com Tour in 2014...In his lone PGA TOUR start, missed the cut at the Reno-Tahoe Open playing on a sponsor exemption.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was an Academic All-American at San Jose State in 2008-11...Won the 2010 Mark Simpson Colorado Invitational...Was the 2011 Western Athletic Conference champion.
tourBios.personal: Has four brothers and one sister...Attended Colorado Academy in Denver, Colo...Was all-state in high school in both golf and basketball...Earliest golf memory was hitting golf balls in family backyard in the mountains and then having an "Easter egg hunt" to find them...Picked golf over basketball ("Not tall enough to play in the NBA.")...If not a professional golfer, he would be playing professional basketball...Biggest thrill outside golf is heli-skiing...Favorite course he's played is Cypress Point...Likes all Colorado sports teams and follows the San Jose State Spartans...Favorite TV show is "The League" and favorite movie is "Forgetting Sarah Marshall"...Favorite entertainers are Lupe Fiasco and Drake...Favorite book is Mastery...Likes sushi and Kobe Bryant...Favorite places are New York and Mexico...Would trade places with Justin Timberlake for a day...Dream foursome would be E. Harvie Ward, Walter Hagen and Graeme McDowell...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National, setting foot on every continent and riding an elephant...Supports the Salvation Army...First-tee intro song would be "The Instrumental" by Lupe Fiasco...Twitter name is @homelessgolf.

tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made eight cuts in nine starts with three top 10s including a win at the Wildfire Invitational in September. At the ATB Financial Classic, T12 with an 11-under 277...Two weeks later, at The Great Waterway Classic, solid rounds of 69-68-68-67 earned him a T10...Claimed his first Tour win with a 20-under 264 at the Wildfire Invitational. Posted back-to-back 65s Friday and Saturday, thanks to 13 birdies. Continued solid play Sunday with five birdies and no bogeys to earn his first Tour victory...T7 at the season-ending Tour Championship Canada. Ranked third on the Order of Merit.

2012: Posted a season-best finish of T6 at The Players Cup, one of four top-10s. Finished in the top 25 in four of his first five events on Tour.

2011: Turned pro in the fall and posted his first victory on the Golden State Tour at the Twin Oaks Championship. Finished 15th on the Order of Merit with $19,096.96

Has also competed on Golden State Tour. 

2014-15: Despite a pair of top-25 finishes and 15 made cuts in 25 starts, failed to advance to the FedExCup Playoffs, finishing outside the top 125 in the FedExCup standings after the Wyndham Championship at No. 164...Proposed to his girlfriend on No. 18 at Pebble Beach after the first round of the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am...Was a DQ from The Honda Classic for failing to register for the event. Got into the field Thursday morning less than an hour before his tee time...Held the first-round lead at the Puerto Rico Open before settling for T27...In the Web.com Tour Finals, opened with a missed cut at the Hotel Fitness Championship and a T30 at the Small Business Connection Championship at River Run, before busting out with a T5 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, where he closed with a 67 to climb from a tie for 30th after three rounds to earn $35,125. That turned out to be enough to secure his TOUR card. Closed the year with a 70th-place effort at the Web.com Tour Championship. Was 36th on the final priority-ranking order.

2013-14: Finished his Web.com Tour season with 24 starts during the 25-tournament season. Highlights included a runner-up performance, six top-10s and nine top-25s. Played on the weekend 19 times...In October 2013, made the cut (69th) after Monday qualifying for the Frys.com Open on the 2013-14 PGA TOUR season...Barely made the cut at the Chile Classic after opening with rounds of 69-73 in the Tour's second event of 2014; was T59. Fired 67-68 on the weekend to finish T9, posting his first career Web.com Tour top-10. Made a hole-in-one on the 11th hole of the third round...Opened the Panama Claro Championship in March with a 72. Fired a bogey-free 63 in the second round and was one stroke off the lead. A pair of 70s on the weekend resulted in a T8. Jumped from 33rd to 14th on the money list...In mid-April, was T36 after 54 holes of El Bosque Mexico Championship. Fired a 67 in the final round to climb to T9...Entered the final round of the BMW Charity Pro-Am in mid-May T17 after rounds of 66-67-72. Posted a Sunday 66 to finish T9...Fired a bogey-free 64 in the second round of the Cleveland Open after a 72 in the first round. Posted 70-69 for a T10 performance...Later in June, entered the final round of the United Leasing Championship with a two-stroke lead. Despite a double bogey on the par-5 third hole, maintained his advantage heading into the back nine. He bogeyed Nos. 13 and 14 and was tied for the lead with eventual champion Greg Owen coming to the difficult 18th hole at Victoria National GC. Finished T2 after coming up short on his second shot on the par-4 and missing a 10-footer for par...Finished the Regular Season making the cut in his last eight tournaments...Officially secured his 2014-15 PGA TOUR card for the first time at the conclusion of the Regular Season in late-August (18th on the money list).

2013: Played in nine PGA TOUR Canada events, making eight cuts. Had four top-12 finishes, including a victory in the Wildfire Invitational...Also secured a T7 at the Tour Championship to finish the season third on the Order of Merit, which secured him a spot on the Web.com Tour in 2014...In his lone PGA TOUR start, missed the cut at the Reno-Tahoe Open playing on a sponsor exemption.

Amateur: Was an Academic All-American at San Jose State in 2008-11...Won the 2010 Mark Simpson Colorado Invitational...Was the 2011 Western Athletic Conference champion.

Harvie Ward, Walter Hagen and Graeme McDowell...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National, setting foot on every continent and riding an elephant...Supports the Salvation Army...First-tee intro song would be "The Instrumental" by Lupe Fiasco...Twitter name is @homelessgolf.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T15th at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T95th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
